JULY 24.title: How to Collect Dots and Connect Them Backwards
JULY 24.description: One of Steve Jobs’ most influential quotes is “You can’t connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards.” But how do you do that in real life? I’ll walk through my own experiences, growing up in rural Canada, to working in the White House, to now working in open source and at GitHub to share some lived experiences on how to “collect dots” and connect them backwards.

JULY 24.title: ‘Fork in the Road’ = Joy in your Career
JULY 24.description: Not everyone has or knows the linear path to what they want to do in 10+ years. Come learn how I navigated and mapped my career across continents with Microsoft!

JULY 24.title: How Machine Learning is Shaping the Finance Industry
Women In Tech (presented by BDO)
JULY 24.description: Learn about the unique experiences of these women in tech and how to deal with imposter syndrome, prejudice, and more as an underrepresented community.

JULY 24.title: The Hard Thing About Life Long Learning
JULY 24.description: One of the biggest impacts you can have to your success as you embark on a career is to adopt a Growth Mindset. Having a Growth Mindset is vital, especially within the Technology industry as it is important to learn and improve over time. Rishan Lye, Partner at BDO Canada, will share strategies he has discovered through his career path to accelerate that growth.

JULY 24.title: Career Fair
JULY 24.description: Meet our sponsors and ask your questions to recruiters!

JULY 24.title: Speed Networking
JULY 24.description: Meet other passionate students from around the world!

JULY 24.title: Resume Roast
JULY 24.description: Join JobJunxion as they judge a series of student tech resumes! Gain key takeaways to use on your own resumes from a modern hiring platform.

JULY 24.title: Navigating a Career in Tech through Networking
The Eye in the Sky: Introduction to Satellite Intelligence
Building Happy Engineering Teams at Scale
JULY 24.description: Leadership in technology integrates both aspects of software engineering and management. Come out to learn more about how to foster a positive work environment in a SWE team.

JULY 24.title: Achieving Viral Business Growth AMA
JULY 24.description: So many businesses have skyrocketed and have achieved high levels of growth in a short period of time - learn how you can do the same in this workshop!

JULY 24.title: Gen Z Entrepreneurship
JULY 24.description: Join founders of viral social apps and startups backed by the most prolific investors in Silicon Valley as they discuss the ups and downs of building a company as a Zoomer.

JULY 24.title: Diversity in Tech (presented by Geotab)
JULY 24.description: With tech growing rapidly, it's important we focus on diversity first. Join us in conversation with 5 outstanding senior leaders who’ve been fighting at big organizations to make tech more inclusive.

JULY 24.title: Breaking into PM From a Non-technical Background
JULY 24.description: It took Helen 500 job applications to land her first PM role. Join her as she shares her learnings gained during the job search process - pivoting from an Earth Science background, to getting into PM at companies like Zynga, Microsoft and Github.

JULY 24.title: Data Science Code-Along (presented by BDO)
JULY 24.description: Our BDO Team will be hosting an interactive workshop on data science initiatives in the industry. We will showcase a coding problem which participants can either follow along while BDO codes the solution, or participants can code their own unique solution for a chance to win a prize.

JULY 24.title: The Future of Education, Today
JULY 24.description: Education hasn't seen much innovation for the past 100 years. With the initiatives our panelists are part of, it'll look radically different within the next 10.

JULY 24.title: How to Build Great Products
JULY 24.description: Ever wondered how to create something used by millions of people every day? Tune in to see how you can create change.

JULY 25.title: 5G Virtual Tour (presented by Huawei)
JULY 25.description: We hear a lot of about digital transformation and the Internet of Things, but what does it entail? How are we going to deal with all the data that is created, exchanged, and stored? Attend this event to get a behind-the-scene look at how a future where everything is connected is taking shape with the help of 5G, optical fiber, artificial intelligence, and energy-efficient data servers.

JULY 25.title: Arming the Rebels with Commerce
JULY 25.description: The president of Shopify sits down with one of their largest merchants do discuss how Shopify's helping anyone get started with entrepreneurship, no matter how small.

JULY 25.title: Rejuvenation Biotechnology: Why Age May Soon Cease to Mean Aging
JULY 25.description: People are living longer - no longer because of reduced child mortality, but because we are postponing the ill-health of old age. But we’ve seen nothing yet: regenerative medicine and other new medicines will eventually be so comprehensive that people will stay truly youthful however long they live, which means they may mostly live very long indeed. Aubrey will discuss both the biology and the sociology of what will be the most momentous advance in the history of civilisation.

JULY 25.title: Data Science Panel
JULY 25.description: Learn how to break into the Data Science field and what a data scientist's day-to-day looks like!

JULY 25.title: Innovation in Asia's Blooming Tech Ecosystem
JULY 25.description: Asia is a hub of innovation that is often overshadowed by Silicon Valley. Join us at this panel to learn about the most interesting Asian companies and the Asian tech landscape.

JULY 25.title: Designing Your Landing Page with Figma
JULY 25.description: If you want to stand out, having a great landing page is a must. Learn how to use Figma to create a page that'll convert

JULY 25.title: Landing Your Dream Job Without Applying
JULY 25.description: Ever wonder how you can land your dream job as Fall comes around? Jonathan Javier and Jerry Lee, Co-Founder of Wonsulting, will be hosting a workshop to help you turn from underdogs into winners with their strategies. The workshop will consist of: 1) how do you proactively recruit and network to land your dream job and 2) how do you build a personal brand where opportunities come to you instead of you always having to seek opportunities.

JULY 25.title: Career Fair
JULY 25.description: Meet our sponsors and ask your questions to recruiters!

JULY 25.title: Speed Networking
JULY 25.description: Meet other passionate students from around the world!

JULY 25.title: Harnessing the Power of Community
JULY 25.description: Repl.it, a Y Combinator startup, is a collaborative IDE with nearly 2 million users - most of which are students. Come listen to Amjad, the CEO, talk about how community has been the foundation of success for his company.

JULY 25.title: Applications of AI and How You Can Get Involved
JULY 25.description: Everyone knows AI is the future, but what does that look like exactly? Join this session for a breakdown of AI applications and how you can get involved

JULY 25.title: Life, Career, and TPM
JULY 25.description: Listen to Jenn discuss her journey breaking into technical product management and her extensive experiences in the industry.

JULY 25.title: Cali or Bust: Busted?
JULY 25.description: Two people. Two perspectives on 'Silicon Valley'. Matt and Kai discuss the 'Cali or Bust' mentality when it comes to the common dream of moving one's tech career to the San Francisco Bay Area

JULY 25.title: Different Paths into SWE
JULY 25.description: No matter your background - a coding bootcamp, a college dropout, a CS major - there's a way to break into software engineering. Learn how you can do the same in this panel!

JULY 25.title: Breaking into Venture Capital as a Student
JULY 25.description: Ever wondered how to break into venture capital as an undergrad? Join this panel to learn how the industry works and how you can start getting involved even as a college student!
